'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/6940c64d2e1f2da9b7e9f17cf756d9955c21c76b', 'message': 'Victoria final releases for cycle-with-rc projects

This tags the final release for all cycle-with-rc projects for Victoria.
While not required, having PTLs ack this patch would be nice to include
that record in the merged metadata.

Release activity should now be frozen until this is processed on Oct 14.
Any bugfixes merged to stable/victoria can be queued up and ready to go
as a follow on stable release after the coordinated release date.

There are different diff-start values for each project. This is used
when generating release notes to denote the point where the
stable/ussuri branch started to diverge from what is included on
stable/victoria. For some, this will be the final Ussuri major version,
but if multiple RCs were done, this may show the initial RC1 release
version. This is normal.

Change-Id: I71d78cf386b960c20f6f453fb13c263d4c9b2e18
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Victoria final releases for cycle-with-rc projects

This tags the final release for all cycle-with-rc projects for Victoria.
While not required, having PTLs ack this patch would be nice to include
that record in the merged metadata.

Release activity should now be frozen until this is processed on Oct 14.
Any bugfixes merged to stable/victoria can be queued up and ready to go
as a follow on stable release after the coordinated release date.

There are different diff-start values for each project. This is used
when generating release notes to denote the point where the
stable/ussuri branch started to diverge from what is included on
stable/victoria. For some, this will be the final Ussuri major version,
but if multiple RCs were done, this may show the initial RC1 release
version. This is normal.

Change-Id: I71d78cf386b960c20f6f453fb13c263d4c9b2e18
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Checks for heat_user_domain explicitly

The script should check for heat_user_domain explicitly instead of matching on "heat"

Closes-Bug: #1839824
Change-Id: Iac83444487d2aa96a0f90086029f43922d1e7856

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I395c86300f3231f822b12a664d2f426fe2052ec4

commit_message:
Fix error handling on instance create

exception.BadRequest expects string as a 'message' argument, so we can't
pass ValueError without casting it to string.

Change-Id: Iff43c38dca596e694cc7c6bc20e71669d83e31e2

commit_message:
Do not pass BOOTIF=None if no BOOTIF can be guessed

It breaks inspection with the default add_ports=pxe.

Change-Id: I730b4bbd48e7188148669670fdb742b88a62f820

commit_message:
Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

Change-Id: I5bcdb5757051418c2ed1a45f49caeffebea4201c

commit_message:
Add create tags for server

Add API of creating tags for one server by
'openstack server tag create --os-compute-api-version <server> <tag>'.
This command requires ``--os-compute-api-version`` 2.26 or greater.
The <server> is name or ID of one server.
The <tag> is tag(s) to add.
Add unittest for the api.

Change-Id: I09bda6ed5d981a5a62ce3dd73c1c4e5e61093466

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-01-15 19:19:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2ac76c48fb91d2bc09f1962ef2ede9b1da970d25', 'message': 'Make overcommit check for pinned instance pagesize aware

When working on a fix for bug #1811870, it was noted that the check to
ensure pinned instances do not overcommit was not pagesize aware. This
means if an instance without hugepages boots on a host with a large
number of hugepages allocated, it may not get all of the memory
allocated to it. Move this check to the same place where pagesize-aware
checks are done, resolving the issue.

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2020-09-15 15:21:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0af0f36300eab647d9dc44fc1f809b8cfd49ad9f', 'message': 'Make overcommit check for pinned instance pagesize aware

When working on a fix for bug #1811870, it was noted that the check to
ensure pinned instances do not overcommit was not pagesize aware. This
means if an instance without hugepages boots on a host with a large
number of hugepages allocated, it may not get all of the memory
allocated to it. Put in concrete terms, consider a host with 1 NUMA
cell, 2 CPUs, 1G of 4k pages, and a single 1G page. If you boot a first
instance with 1 CPU, CPU pinning, 1G of RAM, and no specific page size,
the instance should boot successfully. An attempt to boot a second
instance with the same configuration should fail because there is only
the single 1G page available, however, this is not currently the case.
The reason this happens is because we currently have two tests: a first
that checks total (not free!) host pages and a second that checks free
memory but with no consideration for page size. The first check passes
because we have 1G worth of 4K pages configured and the second check
passes because we have the single 1G page.

Close this gap.

Change-Id: I74861a67827dda1ab2b8451967f5cf0ae93a4ad3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811886

The reason this happens is because we currently have two tests: a first
that checks total (not free!) host pages and a second that checks free
memory but with no consideration for page size. The first check passes
because we have 1G worth of 4K pages configured and the second check
passes because we have the single 1G page.

Close this gap.

Change-Id: I74861a67827dda1ab2b8451967f5cf0ae93a4ad3

commit_message:
Make overcommit check for pinned instance pagesize aware

When working on a fix for bug #1811870, it was noted that the check to
ensure pinned instances do not overcommit was not pagesize aware. This
means if an instance without hugepages boots on a host with a large
number of hugepages allocated, it may not get all of the memory
allocated to it. Put in concrete terms, consider a host with 1 NUMA
cell, 2 CPUs, 1G of 4k pages, and a single 1G page. If you boot a first
instance with 1 CPU, CPU pinning, 1G of RAM, and no specific page size,
the instance should boot successfully. An attempt to boot a second
instance with the same configuration should fail because there is only
the single 1G page available, however, this is not currently the case.
The reason this happens is because we currently have two tests: a first
that checks total (not free!) host pages and a second that checks free
memory but with no consideration for page size. The first check passes
because we have 1G worth of 4K pages configured and the second check
passes because we have the single 1G page.

Close this gap.

Change-Id: I74861a67827dda1ab2b8451967f5cf0ae93a4ad3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811886

commit_message:
fullstack: Fetch created subnet in loop

In case neutron-server raises BadRequest, try to list subnets for the
given network in the hope that some internal delay causes the issue, but
the subnet creation is ready.

Change-Id: Ie5db7c3c7e182aba07cd6da99c6c70b905f6de47
Closes-Bug: #1893188

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I13304665086ad547307dd46e9ff0d116c70a7783

commit_message:
Define condition for the first play host one time

We use the same condition, which defines against what host some "service"
tasks should run against, several times. It's hard to keep it the same
across the role and ansible spending additional resources to evaluate
it each time, so it's simpler and better for the maintenance to set
a boolean variable which will say for all tasks, that we want to run
only against signle host, if they should run or not now.

Change-Id: I78d44704a0224b2c73832a607e84ea8d9499f8c2

commit_message:
Set up health_manager processes based on worker-multiplier

Properly limit the number of processes with worker-multiplier instead of
spawning as many workers as available CPU threads.

Change-Id: I7f42e131d7de4a58a926b634950969e6f406bb10
Closes-Bug: #1889731

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie4e8adf4d1e8eb379fc4c8d8aa7e02c4ef411951

commit_message:
Load roles from /usr/share/ansible/roles

For content provider c7 jobs, we need to consume
ansible-role-container-registry role from package which is
installed at /usr/share/ansible/roles. In order to discover
above path, the path needs to be append in ansible.cfg
otherwise it will give role not found.

Change-Id: Ia314e934dadaf05b8aa1e044ea017926efcd53ef
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/35/757535/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[Doc] datastore guide

Change-Id: Id2ab6f94a372395563eef12a6fd5f0682eb94777
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/94/757794/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: A datastore is typically created as a type of database, e.g. the cloud admin could create 2 datastores for MySQL and PostgreSQL, separately. For each datastore, there could be multiple datastore versions. For example, for MySQL database, Trove could support 5.7.29, 5.7.30 or 5.8, etc. .. note:: Starting from Victoria, the datastore version name must be the same with the image tag of the specific database. To support MySQL 5.7.29, a new datastore version named 5.7.29 based on `mysql docker image https://hub.docker.com/_/mysql?tab=tags&name=5.7.29`_ needs to be created. .. code-block:: console $ openstack datastore version set <version-id> --disableFor datastore versions that are created using image ID, it's easy to switch to.. code-block:: console $ openstack datastore version set <version-id> --image-tags trove,mysql
deleted_lines: A datastore is typically created as a type of database. For each datastore, there could be multiple datastore versions. For example, for MySQL database, Trove could support 5.7.29, 5.7.30 or 5.8. .. code-block:: console $ openstack datastore version set <version-id> --disableFor datastore versions what are created using image ID, it's easy to switch to .. code-block:: console $ openstack datastore version set <version-id> --image-tags trove,mysql

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: I0cc7070c971a15873e008a2c6937ce5ac6d24ffa
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Fix ignored unit test cases for nova::migration::libvirt

Change-Id: I6b1e8ad45d5e3f42529665616ae7cb28b3c27acb
(cherry picked from commit 079ab8d6630733fa4e666c9819432026831501a1)
(cherry picked from commit 50005cfa586e42cb7cebdb6393d5348c09c72824)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/64/757164/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it { is_expected.to contain_file_line('/etc/default/libvirtd libvirtd opts').with( :path => '/etc/default/libvirtd', :line => 'libvirtd_opts="-l"', :match => 'libvirtd_opts=', :tag => 'libvirt-file_line', ) } context 'with libvirt < 5.6' do let :params do { :transport => 'tls', :libvirt_version => '4.5' } end it { is_expected.to contain_file_line('/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd libvirtd args').with( :path => '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd', :line => 'LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--listen"', :match => '^LIBVIRTD_ARGS=', :tag => 'libvirt-file_line', )} it { is_expected.to_not contain_service('libvirtd-tls') } it { is_expected.to_not contain_service('libvirtd-tcp') } context 'with libvirt >= 5.6' do context 'with tls transport' do let :params do { :transport => 'tls', :libvirt_version => '5.6' } end it { is_expected.to_not contain_file_line('/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd libvirtd args') } it { is_expected.to contain_service('libvirtd-tls').with( :name => 'libvirtd-tls.socket', :ensure => 'running', :enable => true, )} context 'with tcp transport' do let :params do { :transport => 'tcp', :libvirt_version => '5.6' } end it { is_expected.to_not contain_file_line('/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd libvirtd args') } it { is_expected.to contain_service('libvirtd-tcp').with( :name => 'libvirtd-tcp.socket', :ensure => 'running', :enable => true, )} end it_behaves_like 'nova migration with libvirt' case facts[:osfamily] when 'Debian' it_behaves_like 'nova migration with libvirt in Debian' when 'RedHat' it_behaves_like 'nova migration with libvirt in RedHat' end
deleted_lines: it { is_expected.to contain_file_line('/etc/default/libvirtd libvirtd opts').with(:line => 'libvirtd_opts="-l"') } context 'with tls transport' do let(:params) do { :transport => 'tls' } end it { is_expected.to contain_service('libvirtd-tls').with( :name => 'libvirtd-tls.socket', :ensure => 'running', :enable => true, )} context 'with tls transport' do let(:params) do { :transport => 'tcp' } it { is_expected.to contain_service('libvirtd-tcp').with( :name => 'libvirtd-tcp.socket', :ensure => 'running', :enable => true, )} it_configures 'nova migration with libvirt'

commit_message:
Remove usage of six

Remove six-library Replace the following items with Python 3 style code.
- six.string_types
- six.moves
- six.iteritems

Change-Id: I30358b3b08cc076ac59bd325d0e11a3e2deabde3

commit_message:
Supports for multi_tenant driver of projects using multi-tenant projectId, specified via annotation

driver of multi-tenant project:
multi_tenant = kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers.multi_tenant_project:MultiTenantPodProjectDriver
multi_tenant = kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers.multi_tenant_project:MultiTenantServiceProjectDriver
multi_tenant = kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers.multi_tenant_project:MultiTenantNamespaceProjectDriver
multi_tenant = kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers.multi_tenant_project:MultiTenantNetworkPolicyProjectDriver

Implements: blueprint kuryr-multi-tenant-support.
Change-Id: I4fa8e6c5be5f9d41058682611d83162a4346a98a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/93/757993/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from kuryr_kubernetes import config from kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers import base from kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers import utils as driver_utils class MultiTenantPodProjectDriver(base.PodProjectDriver): """Provides project ID for Pod port based on annotations or a configuration option. """ def get_project(self, pod): namespace = pod['metadata']['namespace'] net_crd = driver_utils.get_kuryrnetwork_crds(namespace) if net_crd['spec'].get('projectId'): project_id = net_crd['spec'].get('projectId') else: project_id = config.CONF.neutron_defaults.project if not project_id: raise cfg.RequiredOptError('project', cfg.OptGroup('neutron_defaults')) return project_id class MultiTenantServiceProjectDriver(base.ServiceProjectDriver): """Provides project ID for Service based on annotations or a configuration option. """ def get_project(self, service): namespace = service['metadata']['namespace'] net_crd = driver_utils.get_kuryrnetwork_crds(namespace) if net_crd['spec'].get('projectId'): project_id = net_crd['spec'].get('projectId') else: project_id = config.CONF.neutron_defaults.project if not project_id: raise cfg.RequiredOptError('project', cfg.OptGroup('neutron_defaults')) return project_id class MultiTenantNamespaceProjectDriver(base.NamespaceProjectDriver): """Provides project ID for Namespace based on annotations or a configuration option. """ def get_project(self, namespace): ns_crd = driver_utils.get_namespace(namespace) if ns_crd['metadata'].get('labels') and \ ns_crd['metadata'].get('labels').get('projectId'): project_id = ns_crd['metadata'].get('labels').get('projectId') else: project_id = config.CONF.neutron_defaults.project if not project_id: raise cfg.RequiredOptError('project', cfg.OptGroup('neutron_defaults')) return project_id class MultiTenantNetworkPolicyProjectDriver(base.NetworkPolicyProjectDriver): """Provides project ID for NetworkPolicy based on annotations or a configuration option. """ def get_project(self, policy): namespace = policy['metadata']['namespace'] net_crd = driver_utils.get_kuryrnetwork_crds(namespace) if net_crd['spec'].get('projectId'): project_id = net_crd['spec'].get('projectId') else: project_id = config.CONF.neutron_defaults.project if not project_id: raise cfg.RequiredOptError('project', cfg.OptGroup('neutron_defaults')) return project_id

added_lines: date: 2020-10-12 id: OSSA-2020-007 title: Remote code execution in blazar-dashboard description: > Lukas Euler (Positive Security) reported a vulnerability in blazar-dashboard. A user allowed to access the Blazar dashboard in Horizon may trigger code execution on the Horizon host as the user the Horizon service runs under. This may result in Horizon host unauthorized access and further compromise of the Horizon service. All setups using the Horizon dashboard with the blazar-dashboard plugin are affected. affected-products: - product: blazar-dashboard version: '<1.3.1, ==2.0.0, ==3.0.0' vulnerabilities: - cve-id: CVE-2020-26943 reporters: - name: Lukas Euler affiliation: Positive Security reported: - CVE-2020-26943 issues: links: - https://launchpad.net/bugs/1895688 reviews: wallaby: - https://review.opendev.org/755810 victoria: - https://review.opendev.org/756064 ussuri: - https://review.opendev.org/755812 train: - https://review.opendev.org/755813 stein: - https://review.opendev.org/755814

commit_message:
Make permissions tests work

Permissions JS tests are testing promises, however "then" callback functions
aren't called since digest cycles were never triggered. Jasmine Spec Runner
marks them 'passed' only adding "SPEC HAS NO EXPECTATIONS" into their names.
This patch triggers a digest by calling a scope's $apply functions and makes
the tests work.

Partial-Bug: #1894127

Change-Id: I2d13664df42f23f1436f6231fd3cec56475f7e8d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/66/752766/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: select = eventlet.patcher.original('select') poller = select.poll() fd_map = {} for i, sock in enumerate(self.tracking_data['orphans']): fd_map[sock.fileno()] = i poller.register(sock, select.POLLHUP) for fd, event in poller.poll(0): self.logger.notice('Replacing shut down socket') # Close out the old self.tracking_data['orphans'][fd_map[fd]].close() # and get a fresh socket self.tracking_data['orphans'][fd_map[fd]] = get_socket(self.conf) def log_sock_exit(self, sock, _unused, signum): if signum is None: self.logger.notice('Child %d exiting normally', os.getpid()) else: signame = SIGNUM_TO_NAME.get(signum, 'unknown signal %d' % signum) self.logger.notice('Child %d exiting normally following %s', os.getpid(), signame) poller = select.poll() fd_map = {} for port, socks in self.tracking_data['orphans'].items(): for i, sock in enumerate(socks): fd_map[sock.fileno()] = (port, i) poller.register(sock, select.POLLHUP) for fd, event in poller.poll(0): port, i = fd_map[fd] self.logger.notice('Replacing shut down sock for port %d', port) # Close out the old self.tracking_data['orphans'][port][i].close() # and get a fresh socket self.tracking_data['orphans'][port][i] = self._bind_port(port) def log_sock_exit(self, sock, port, signum): if signum is None: self.logger.notice('Child (PID %d, port %d) exiting normally', os.getpid(), port) else: signame = SIGNUM_TO_NAME.get(signum, 'unknown signal %d' % signum) self.logger.notice( 'Child (PID %d, port %d) exiting normally following %s', os.getpid(), port, signame) # we can't really do a seamless reload, but a graceful exit seems # better than an immediate exit signal_context = [None] signal_context[0] = signum def shutdown(signum, *args): signal_context[0] = signum greenio.shutdown_safe(sock) signal.signal(signal.SIGHUP, shutdown) strategy.log_sock_exit(sock, sock_info, signal_context[0])
deleted_lines: def log_sock_exit(self, sock, _unused): self.logger.notice('Child %d exiting normally' % os.getpid()) def log_sock_exit(self, sock, port): self.logger.notice('Child (PID %d, port %d) exiting normally', os.getpid(), port) signal.signal(signal.SIGHUP, stop_accepting) strategy.log_sock_exit(sock, sock_info)

commit_message:
Nova: Archive/Purge all cell databases

This patch enables --all-cells option in nova db archive/purge command,
to make the command process soft-deleted records in Cell databases.

Change-Id: I4afe15393ab8ea6eb9251dddd1bd211467fe7186
Closes-Bug: #1898508

commit_message:
New proxy logging field for wire status

Capture the on the wire status code for logging because we change the
logged status code sometimes.

Closes-Bug: #1896518
Change-Id: I27feabe923a6520e983637a9c68a19ec7174a0df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/39/755639/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: wire_status_int The status sent to the client, which may be different than the logged response code if there was an error during the body of the request or a disconnect.

commit_message:
tests: Make test_delete_container_versions less flakey

Hammering that test in a tight loop, I'd often see failures due to
ordering issues. Make the delete single-threaded to avoid that.

Change-Id: Iff45be32a7c3f258214cce78001fd33ad0a39b8c

commit_message:
Add 'server migration abort' command

This is equivalent to nova client's 'live-migration-abort' command.

Change-Id: I0ff520ccfdf2de52c427affad7bef4554c86a06f
Story: 2007489
Task: 39210
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/60/716960/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: migration_group.add_argument( '--live-migration-abort', dest='abort_migration', help=_('Abort an on-going live migration. ' 'Usage --live-migration-abort <migration_ID>.') ) def _make_migration_object(self, migration_id): compute_client = self.app.client_manager.compute migration = utils.find_resource( compute_client.servers, migration_id ) return migration if parsed_args.server: server = utils.find_resource( compute_client.servers, parsed_args.server, ) if parsed_args.abort_migration: migration = self._make_migration_object( parsed_args.abort_migration ) compute_client.server_migrations.live_migration_abort( server, migration )

command.

Story: 2007513
Task: 39293

' 'Usage --live-migration-force-complete <migration_ID>.') ) if parsed_args.server: server = utils.find_resource( compute_client.servers, parsed_args.server, ) if parsed_args.force_migration: migration = parsed_args.force_migration compute_client.server_migrations.live_migrate_force_complete( server, migration )

commit_message:
Dep's should be restricted by upper-constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs which may
not be supported by stable and lower branches, so should be
restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I65faaf3203ba4be2ceea1168745de4236dc7df53

commit_message:
Add Python3 wallaby unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for wallaby.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic528f2e22d33b6d674a9369dafb1c297b30f4e38
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-watcherclient refs/changes/54/750754/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[Ussuri Only] Cleanup workaround for CentOS7

This patch removes some workarounds, which were introduced because of
missing ussuri release on CentOS7 in RDO project, since CentOS7 is
no longer used in beaker tests.

Change-Id: Idbb6a51292c7c238cce808bc467899ab83166971

The quarantine-on-close is not possible because we're calling
see_object() when df is not open. So, let's leave this alone.
However, I think we might want the following:

 - Do not call other plugins if one plugin forces quarantine.

Change-Id: I97e3e86a441c105f71a36cec96da308b70ab3fa5
"}]
commit_message:
DNM: follow-up for Dark Data #35

The quarantine-on-close is not possible because we're calling
see_object() when df is not open. So, let's leave this alone.
However, I think we might want the following:

 - Do not call other plugins if one plugin forces quarantine.

 - Do not open df if we don't need it open, which is always.

Change-Id: I97e3e86a441c105f71a36cec96da308b70ab3fa5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/63/756163/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def policy_based_object_handling(self, df, metadata): obj_path = metadata['name'] if self.dark_data_policy == "quarantine": self.logger.info("quarantining dark data %s" % (obj_path,)) raise df._quarantine(df._data_file, "Requested by dark data plugin") elif self.dark_data_policy == "log": self.logger.info("reporting dark data %s" % (obj_path,)) elif self.dark_data_policy == "delete": self.logger.info("deleting dark data %s" % (obj_path,)) os.unlink(df._ondisk_info['data_file']) self.policy_based_object_handling(df, object_metadata)
deleted_lines: def policy_based_object_handling(self, df): with df.open(modernize=True): metadata = df.get_metadata() obj_path = metadata['name'] if self.dark_data_policy == "quarantine": self.logger.info("quarantining dark data %s" % (obj_path,)) df._quarantine(df._data_file, "Requested by dark data plugin") elif self.dark_data_policy == "log": self.logger.info("reporting dark data %s" % (obj_path,)) elif self.dark_data_policy == "delete": self.logger.info("deleting dark data %s" % (obj_path,)) os.unlink(df._ondisk_info['data_file']) df.close() self.policy_based_object_handling(df)

Refactoring: split away continue_node_deploy/clean

To be able to get rid of using RPC for continuing async steps
we need this code to be callable.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/43/756343/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.fail_on_error(utils.deploying_error_handler, _("Unexpected error when processing next deploy step")) @task_manager.require_exclusive_lock def continue_node_deploy(task): """Continue deployment after finishing an async deploy step. This function calculates which step has to run next and passes control into do_next_deploy_step. On the first run, deploy steps and templates are also validated. :param task: a TaskManager instance with an exclusive lock """ node = task.node # Agent is now running, we're ready to validate the remaining steps if not node.driver_internal_info.get('steps_validated'): try: conductor_steps.validate_deploy_templates(task) conductor_steps.set_node_deployment_steps( task, reset_current=False) except exception.IronicException as exc: msg = _('Failed to validate the final deploy steps list ' 'for node %(node)s: %(exc)s') % {'node': node.uuid, 'exc': exc} return utils.deploying_error_handler(task, msg) info = node.driver_internal_info info['steps_validated'] = True node.driver_internal_info = info node.save() next_step_index = utils.update_next_step_index(task, 'deploy') do_next_deploy_step(task, next_step_index)

subject: Don't break long/hyphenated words in RST creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-10-13 17:58:54.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/_exts/vmt.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ossa/commit/e50bcab88c3547e82d1ef452cfeb75aa781ea676', 'message': "Don't break long/hyphenated words in RST creation

The textwrap module by default breaks hyphenated words across line
wrapping boundaries, which Sphinx will then reinterpret as
whitespace. Disable this behavior so that hyphenated words will be
moved to the next line rather than broken at their hyphens. Also
disable a related feature which would break lines longer than the
target line length, allowing one-word lines longer than that.

Change-Id: I2ce8dcd4d67b658817857167e218913c75df0bda
"}]
commit_message:
Don't break long/hyphenated words in RST creation

The textwrap module by default breaks hyphenated words across line
wrapping boundaries, which Sphinx will then reinterpret as
whitespace. Disable this behavior so that hyphenated words will be
moved to the next line rather than broken at their hyphens. Also
disable a related feature which would break lines longer than the
target line length, allowing one-word lines longer than that.

Change-Id: I2ce8dcd4d67b658817857167e218913c75df0bda
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ossa refs/changes/23/757923/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: [Python3] Fix python3 bugs in code

- The BaseException class no longer has a "message"
  attribute in python 3 [1]. On the contrary, the
  string representation of an Exception object will
  print all the exception args in all supported
  python versions, so use that instead.
- Functional tests were run with a specific locale,
  remove those annotations so we can handle unicode
  encoding and decoding in python3 envs.
- Cleanup errors were not being handled correctly,
  cleanup the code so we don't have spurious failures.
- In python3, dict.keys() gives you a view for lazy
  loading, so convert occurrences to lists as expected
  in our functional tests.
- Start capturing STDOUT and STDERR in tox envs to
  enable troubleshooting.

commit_message:
[Python3] Fix python3 bugs in code

- The BaseException class no longer has a "message"
  attribute in python 3 [1]. On the contrary, the
  string representation of an Exception object will
  print all the exception args in all supported
  python versions, so use that instead.
- Functional tests were run with a specific locale,
  remove those annotations so we can handle unicode
  encoding and decoding in python3 envs.
- Cleanup errors were not being handled correctly,
  cleanup the code so we don't have spurious failures.
- In python3, dict.keys() gives you a view for lazy
  loading, so convert occurrences to lists as expected
  in our functional tests.
- Start capturing STDOUT and STDERR in tox envs to
  enable troubleshooting.

Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811627
Closes-Bug: #1811516
Change-Id: Idaa2fb9b60451b3fbd298e19574195f2d663c6f4
[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/#transition-plan
(cherry picked from commit b955ac9064b15d00e8966dda745814c146c8af01)
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Add basepython to tox.ini

Change-Id: I4b731354119ebc3a7519da420121404aa2fbb640
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/97/719597/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove <py3.5 dependencies from requirements.txt

The requirements repo is support python 3.5 as oldest python version
while swift still supports py27.
Thus, requirements-check will fail on a couple of lines in
python-swiftclient.  The check is only run when these files are touched.

The py2.7 packagers we know about aren't depending on upstream
requirements.txt for correctness and aside from all the production
deployments running on py2.7 we only realistically support >=py3.7

There's no good reason for our requirements.txt to be "unspported" by
the openstack requirements check job.  Since they only support >=py3.5
we can change our requirements.txt inline with that.  This should be
fine for everything we could hope to get out of both our
requirements.txt and the check!

Change-Id: I3115eaf87a9d8e184bc5f9c650cf80250a842a0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/50/733050/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # For python 2.7, the following requirements are needed; they are not # included since the requirments-check check will fail otherwise since # global requirements do not support these anymore. # Fortunately, these packages come in as dependencies from others and # thus the py27 jobs still work. # futures>=3.0.0;python_version=='2.7' or python_version=='2.6' # BSD

commit_message:
install venv_build_distro_package_list on venv_wheel_build_enable

This logic looks off, if you're going to do a build, you'd want the
build_distro packages installed right?

I'm missing a bunch of packages listed by *_devel_distro_packages
to complete the task "Install python packages into the venv"

Projects do this;

- name: Install the python venv
  import_role:
    name: "python_venv_build"
  vars:
    venv_build_distro_package_list: "{{ project_devel_distro_packages }}"

Change-Id: Ieeb5af76fb4fcb1c15d3926e1ad2946862495000
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-python_venv_build refs/changes/53/731453/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Update workspace tempest.conf on changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-19 22:45:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/commit/356acd5facea00fc2d764195a3dd87845c5e1692', 'message': 'Update workspace tempest.conf on changes

When updating variables that would result in a modified
tempest.conf, the /root/.tempest/etc/tempest.conf or
/etc/tempest.conf would get updated properly.  A tempest
init happens after and does not copy those into an
existing workspace.  This change allows backup workspaces
to be kept on each modification to keep from loosing any
existing workspaces.

Change-Id: Id2de9cbd0f06b73dead5298afb857df2700bab60

Closes-Bug: #1763336
(cherry picked from commit 7654719383ad8a88db52e37564a8b9f9eaaca939)
'}]
commit_message:
Update workspace tempest.conf on changes

When updating variables that would result in a modified
tempest.conf, the /root/.tempest/etc/tempest.conf or
/etc/tempest.conf would get updated properly.  A tempest
init happens after and does not copy those into an
existing workspace.  This change allows backup workspaces
to be kept on each modification to keep from loosing any
existing workspaces.

Change-Id: Id2de9cbd0f06b73dead5298afb857df2700bab60
Closes-Bug: #1763336
(cherry picked from commit 7654719383ad8a88db52e37564a8b9f9eaaca939)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest refs/changes/32/638032/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: register: copy_tempest_config - name: Move over workspace when config is updated shell: | set -e . {{ tempest_venv_bin }}/activate if tempest workspace list | grep ' workspace '; then # Get a backup suffix export CURDATE=$(date +"%d%^b%g_%H%M%S%Z") # Get the dirname for 'workspace' directly from the tempest workspace list WSPATH=$(dirname $(tempest workspace list | awk '{if($2 == "workspace"){print $4}}')) # Rename the workspace tempest workspace rename --old-name workspace --new-name workspace_${CURDATE} # A workspace move only changes the config. The move happens manually. if [ -d "${WSPATH}/workspace" ] then mv ${WSPATH}/workspace ${WSPATH}/workspace_${CURDATE} tempest workspace move --name workspace_${CURDATE} --path ${WSPATH}/workspace_${CURDATE}/ fi exit 3 fi args: executable: /bin/bash register: tempest_move_workspace changed_when: tempest_move_workspace.rc == 3 failed_when: - tempest_move_workspace.rc != 0 - tempest_move_workspace.rc != 3 when: copy_tempest_config.changed

commit_message:
Skip boostrap-ansible on upgrades if already run

Skips bootstrap-ansible on a rerun if it has already run
previously.

Moves the working directory creation to it's own function
so that the lock directory is created earlier.

Change-Id: I156e0143991c79cc2f664a98b6cd22353c01b55d
(cherry picked from commit e4ae0931f19242f947e463b41132826f83c5c278)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/04/655704/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function create_working_dir { if [ ! -d "/etc/openstack_deploy/upgrade-${TARGET_SERIES}" ]; then mkdir -p "/etc/openstack_deploy/upgrade-${TARGET_SERIES}" fi } function bootstrap_ansible { if [ ! -f "/etc/openstack_deploy/upgrade-${TARGET_SERIES}/bootstrap-ansible.complete" ]; then "${SCRIPTS_PATH}/bootstrap-ansible.sh" touch /etc/openstack_deploy/upgrade-${TARGET_SERIES}/bootstrap-ansible.complete else echo "Ansible has been bootstrapped for ${TARGET_SERIES} already, skipping..." fi } create_working_dir bootstrap_ansible

subject: Add an ability to use custom PyPi index for deploy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-24 14:08:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/6e17c6302497036f1aaa20a63237ea52cfa9870c', 'message': 'Use standard env variables for the AIO bootstrap

This change apply custom overrides set via environment settings to
leverage UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE, PIP_OPTS and GET_PIP_URL settings
for AIO.

Also we bring the two new environment variables INDEX_URL and
TRUSTED_HOST to override default PyPi index repos. The AIO bootstrap
use these variables to update/build PIP_OPTS vairable.

This change also include some fixes for the PIP_OPTS introduced in
the Ic966bafd04c4c01b3d93851a0e3ec2c1f3312f28.

This change applies custom overrides set via environment settings to
leverage UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE, PIP_OPTS and GET_PIP_URL settings
for AIO.

Also, we add new environment variables PIP_PYPI_MIRROR,
PIP_WHEEL_MIRROR and PIP_MIRROR_HOST to override default PyPi index
repos. The AIO bootstrap leverages these variables to update/build
PIP_OPTS variable. These variables bring an ability to bootstrap
AIO on any CI, so later NODEPOOL_PYPI_MIRROR, NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST,
and NODEPOOL_WHEEL_MIRROR from the /etc/ci/mirror_info.sh could be
used to set them.

This change also include some fixes for the PIP_OPTS introduced in
the Ic966bafd04c4c01b3d93851a0e3ec2c1f3312f28.

Change-Id: Ic051173eb4d493c9201d9580becf8bab5ac18b45

This change applies custom overrides set via environment settings to
leverage UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE, PIP_OPTS and GET_PIP_URL settings
for AIO.

Also, we add new environment variables PIP_PYPI_MIRROR,
PIP_WHEEL_MIRROR and PIP_MIRROR_HOST to override default PyPi index
repos. The AIO bootstrap leverages these variables to update/build
PIP_OPTS variable. These variables bring an ability to bootstrap
AIO on any CI, so later NODEPOOL_PYPI_MIRROR, NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST,
and NODEPOOL_WHEEL_MIRROR from the /etc/ci/mirror_info.sh could be
used to set them.

Also, bootstrap-ansible.sh now creates the ~/.pydistutils.cfg file if
environment variables described above are set. We create this file
from scratch and use the same settings used on the Zuul CI in the
Ie4ce336174aa2a825d125f7e0d9a256de139908b change.

This change also include some fixes for the PIP_OPTS introduced in
the Ic966bafd04c4c01b3d93851a0e3ec2c1f3312f28.

from scratch and use the same settings used on the Zuul CI in the
Ie4ce336174aa2a825d125f7e0d9a256de139908b change.

This change also include some fixes for the PIP_OPTS introduced in
the Ic966bafd04c4c01b3d93851a0e3ec2c1f3312f28.

commit_message:
Add an ability to use custom PyPi index for deploy

This change adds an ability to use any external custom PyPi index
in the air-gapped environments to deploy OSA.

There are added three new environment variables - PIP_PYPI_MIRROR,
PIP_WHEEL_MIRROR and PIP_MIRROR_HOST to override default PyPi index
repos. The 'bootstrap-ansible.sh' and 'bootstrap-aio.sh' leverages
these variables to build/update the PIP_OPTS variable and also
creates '~/.pydistutils.cfg' file only if set and not empty.
The '~/.pydistutils.cfg' created from scratch with the settings
described in the Ie4ce336174aa2a825d125f7e0d9a256de139908b.

This is the second part of the changes which adds an ability to
deploy OAS in the air-gapped environments. The first one introduced
in the Iba750f6c91e7ca15267b728761ef41ecc4bf165f.

This change also include some fixes for the PIP_OPTS introduced in
the Ic966bafd04c4c01b3d93851a0e3ec2c1f3312f28.

Change-Id: Ic051173eb4d493c9201d9580becf8bab5ac18b45
(cherry picked from commit a60e85560d6db622576a67e6515ab658b691e3c3)
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/53/577653/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: index_url: "{{ lookup('env','INDEX_URL') | default(omit) }}" trusted_host: "{{ lookup('env','TRUSTED_HOST') | default(omit) }}" pip_upstream_url: "{{ lookup('env','GET_PIP_URL') | default(omit) }}" pip_get_pip_options: "{{ lookup('env','PIP_OPTS') | default('') }}" pip_install_upper_constraints_url: "{{ pip_install_upper_constraints_proto }}://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?id={{ requirements_git_install_branch | regex_replace(' #.*$','') }}" pip_install_upper_constraints_file: "{{ lookup('env','UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE') | default(omit) }}" --constraint "{{ pip_install_upper_constraints_file | default(pip_install_upper_constraints_url) }}"

commit_message:
Leverage the environment variables for the deploy

This change applies custom overrides set via environment settings to
leverage UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE and GET_PIP_URL already used in the
bootstrap-ansible.sh script. This will add an ability to deploy OSA
in the air-gapped environments because of hardcoded URLs pointed to
the git.openstack.org and bootstrap.pypa.io.

Change-Id: Iba750f6c91e7ca15267b728761ef41ecc4bf165f
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit bdba1b199b1c829dae321866f5218e8426c2511a)

commit_message:
Change haproxy http-check expect for nova_console

Change the haproxy_backend_httpcheck_options to expect an 'OK' string
rather than a 200 response to avoid constant logging of broken pipe
errors in the console proxy services' logs.

Change-Id: I77b7e090aa4331e6a9547e0526a0f291f06a57c0
(cherry picked from commit dc409a98e3d8b3c28cc884442776bd9b525cc851)

commit_message:
Re-enable openSUSE Leap 15.0 aio_metal jobs

These jobs are currently passing and we want to keep them
passing. the _lxc jobs have currently no chance of succeeding
on leap 15.0 because networkd is not available here, so
removing them.

Change-Id: Iea81339907303f3840761a6ee1d89e6f46165f3c
(cherry picked from commit 51b035f50d71c0ffb255397667509abae290e735)

commit_message:
Remove vif_plugin_is_fatal and vif_plugin_timeout values

We are setting these values to False and 10 seconds
respectively and by default it is set to True and 300
seconds, which is the desirable because we don't want
and instance to boot if there was timeout to plug in a
VIF. Also, 10 seconds is a really short timeout for this

Change-Id: I4698d04e08fd0aa162c81d4a4af37a42e938d4f1
(cherry picked from commit 30952d23ec4a136db2fc741534172795c0086fac)

Glance NFS mounts are owned by `root` and are not writable by `glance`
user. Proposed change sets the `{{ glance_nfs_client.local_path }}`
directory ownership to

commit_message:
Fix Glance NFS mount point ownership

Glance NFS mounts are owned by `root` and are not writable by `glance`
user. Proposed change sets the `{{ glance_nfs_client.local_path }}`
directory ownership to
`{{ glance_system_user_name }}:{{ glance_system_group_name }}` so that
Glance can write to that.

Change-Id: I201aeca91442acffa12088c536389679ca2d8982
Closes-Bug: 1813300
Related-Bug: 1759552
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_glance refs/changes/93/633993/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Migrate to content provider jobs/templates

This change migrate c8 jobs/templates to content provider
jos so consumer jobs can use resources built by provider
jobs.

Change-Id: I017e27672ba67ff006b9ba8ea61e9986c38f06c9
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>
